subject: chemistry
title: Properties of Common Compounds MCQ Problems

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which compound is hygroscopic and has a melting point of 800 °C?
problems.hint: It’s common table salt and draws moisture from air.
problems.detailed: Sodium chloride (\(\ce{NaCl}\)) is hygroscopic and has a high melting point of 801 °C.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which is described as a universal solvent with a boiling point of 100 °C?
problems.hint: It's essential for life and often called universal solvent.
problems.detailed: Water (\(\ce{H2O}\)) is a polar molecule, often called the universal solvent, with a boiling point of 100 °C.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which compound is a colorless gas with a pungent smell and a boiling point of –33 °C?
problems.hint: Used in household cleaners and has a strong smell.
problems.detailed: Ammonia (\(\ce{NH3}\)) is a colorless, pungent-smelling gas with a boiling point of –33 °C.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which compound decomposes into (\(\ce{CO2}\)) and (\(\ce{CaO}\)) at high temperatures and is used in cement?
problems.hint: It’s the main component of chalk and limestone.
problems.detailed: Calcium carbonate (\(\ce{CaCO3}\)) decomposes into (\(\ce{CO2}\)) and (\(\ce{CaO}\)) at about 825 °C and is used in cement, chalk, and toothpaste.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which of these is a volatile, colorless liquid that’s flammable and used as both a disinfectant and in alcoholic beverages?
problems.hint: It’s the main alcohol in drinks and hand sanitizers.
problems.detailed: Ethanol (\(\ce{C2H5OH}\)) is a volatile, flammable, colorless liquid used in alcoholic drinks and as a disinfectant solvent.
